description.narrative: I likhet med tidigare program med det maliska nationella institutet för statistik (INSTAT) är det övergripande målet med denna insats att ytterligare stärka kvalitet, tillgänglighet och analys av statistik för användares behov i Mali. Insatsen kommer att pågå från januari 2020 till december 2023. Den föreslagna insatsen består av två huvudkomponenter: En ekonomisk stödkomponent direkt till INSTAT och en teknisk supportkomponent för INSTAT via SCB. De tre huvudsakliga specifika målen för insatsen är följande: o Stärka planering och förvaltning av det nationella statistiksystemet o Bidra till att ytterligare förbättra produkter och kvaliteten av prioriterad statistik (ekonomisk, social och miljörelaterad statistik), o Öka tillgängligheten av data för beslutsfattande och övervakning av nationella och internationella utvecklingsplaner. För att uppnå detta kommer INSTAT och SCB att ta fram social, ekonomisk och miljörelaterad statistik, stärka ledningens kapacitet (administrativ och teknisk personal) samt publicera och sprida statistiska produkter.

Similarly to previous programs with the Malian National institute for Statistics (INSTAT), the overall objective of this contribution is to further strengthen the quality, availability and analysis of statistics for the needs of users in Mali. This program will run from January 2020 to December 2023. The proposed intervention consists of two main components: A financial support component directly to INSTAT, and a technical support component for INSTAT via the Swedish Statistics Central Bureau Statistics (SCB). The following are the three main specific objectives of the intervention o Strengthen the planning and management of the national statistics system o Contribute to further improve products and quality of priority statistics (economic, social and environmental statistics), o Increase availability of data for decision making and monitoring of national and international development plans. To achieve this, INSTAT and SCB will on the production of social, economic and environmental statistics, strengthening the capacities of the management (administrative and technical staff) and the publication and dissemination of statistical products.

The objectives of the intervention are the following:
1. Strengthen the planning and management of the national statistics system 2. Contribute to further improve products and quality of priority statistics (economic, social and environmental statistics), 3. Increase availability of data for decision making and monitoring of national and international development plans.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts

17.18 - By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts.

17.19 - By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries

17.19 - By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries.

title.narrative: Decision on contribution to Mali Instat SCB Fas 3

description.narrative:
Result area one: Management
Embassy assessment: Working with planning processes has been a challenge for INSTAT in 2021. The annual report for the year 2021 mentions that the planning process for 2022 was delayed several months. In addition, the annual report refers to difficulty of coordination between the organisations that are tasked with providing statistics. At the annual meeting on April 13, the management said that the population census consumes a lot of resources. They also agreed to the Embassy's view that planning has been challenging.
This is a risk for INSTAT and the Embassy that the results will not be reached and therefore something for INSTAT to analyze more in depth on the reasons why this not progressing.
Result area 2: production of statistical data
Embassy assessment: The statistical products that were mentioned in the annual report has been cross-referenced on the homepage of INSTAT. The Embassy concludes that most of the statistical data mentioned in the annual report is actually on the homepage. However there are some significant exceptions to this.
- Indice des Prix de Produits Agricoles à la Production, IPPAP (price index of agricultural productiona on the list of publication, on p 16) can not be found on web page.
- Enquete Modulaire et Permanente Aupres des Menages, EMOP (Household survey), The annual report for 2021 is not found on the webpage although the report states that it has been published.
- Mali en chiffres (mali en numbers) : this is supposed to be a yearly product, but it has not been published since 2017.
- Annuaire Statistique du Mali (Annual stastics of Mali) : this data has not been publishes for 2021, all other reports from 2010 until 2020 have been published.
Result area 3: Increase availability of data
Embassy assessment: INSTAT mentions in the annual report that the organisation has been working on information structures. They have bought servers and installed datacenters and worked with online meetings during the pandemic. The Intranet has also been developed although using it has not been to the desired extent. This illustrates one of the internal learning challenges of INSTAT. There is a high expectations that new data infrastructure will lead to immediate results whereas in reality the introduction of new technical applications requires soft skills and new learning in order to be successful.
Conclusion:
INSTAT is in general good in producing statistical data with good quality. The operational aspects of this is generally working. The planning aspects and the organisational learning remain a challenge.
The audit report highlights the need to introduce an annual workplan and notes that this was also the recommendation from the year before. The other five points from last year's audit report have been implemented.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
